poem:
Title: "In the Age of Digital Dawn"

Through scrolling shires of silence,
we tread on hollowed glass.
Unseen wars unfurl in clenched palms,
where power, not peace, is mass.

Gazes bound to seductive streams,
unchartered neighbourhoods done glance-free.
Each thumb-dance inflates our bubbles,
Reflecting only what we wish to see.

A torch in the endless digital night,
But where guides the human heart?
In this world gone flat and pixel-bright,
Can we exist, apart?
